Scan, share, done: WhatsApp update brings in-app scanning for iOS users - details | Mint - Mint
summary:
WhatsApp Introduces In-App Document Scanning for iOS Users

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Live Mint

WhatsApp has launched an in-app scanning feature for iOS users, enhancing document sharing by allowing users to scan documents directly within the app.

Key Points

  • New in-app scanning feature is available in the latest WhatsApp update (version 24.25.80).
  • This feature allows users to scan documents without external tools.
  • Users can adjust scan margins for better quality.
  • The update is currently being rolled out to a select group of iOS users.
  • The feature aims to streamline document sharing for personal and professional use.
“The ability to scan and send documents directly within the instant messaging app removes the reliance on third-party scanning apps.”

This update is seen as a significant improvement in WhatsApp's document-sharing capabilities, making it a more comprehensive communication tool.
newTitle: WhatsApp Introduces In-App Document Scanning for iOS Users

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Live Mint

The tech world is buzzing with anticipation of Apple’s iPhone 18 series, slated for launch in 2026. Analyst Ming-Chi Kuo has predicted a significant upgrade in the iPhone 18 Pro's camera, introducing variable aperture technology.

  • Apple plans to equip the iPhone 18 Pro’s camera with a variable aperture, allowing for better control over light intake and improved image quality in various lighting conditions.
  • This technology is already available in some Android smartphones, indicating a move towards DSLR-like capabilities for Apple users.
  • BE Semiconductor (BESI) will be a key supplier for the necessary equipment for this new feature.
  • Future advancements include Apple's M5 series processors, expected to use TSMC’s advanced N3P node technology.
  • The iPhone 17 line-up is also anticipated to include under-display Face ID technology and advanced camera features.
“If realised, the iPhone 18 Pro would be the first Apple device to adopt such a feature, underlining the company’s commitment to camera innovation.”

This potential upgrade marks a significant step for Apple in enhancing photographic capabilities and illustrates its ongoing commitment to innovation in smartphone technology.

Apple is reportedly working on a new smart doorbell that would utilize Face ID technology. This innovative device aims to enhance home security by unlocking the door automatically when a resident approaches.

  • Analyst Mark Gurman indicates that the smart doorbell will feature Face ID similar to that on iPhone.
  • The device may incorporate Apple’s Secure Enclave chip for processing Face ID data.
  • It is expected to be compatible with existing HomeKit smart locks and utilize Apple’s new Proxima chip for connectivity.
  • The doorbell could back up Face ID data to iCloud, boosting Apple’s cloud subscription services.
  • A new 6-inch touchscreen smart home hub may also accompany the doorbell launch.
  • Expected release date is in late 2025.
“The device will likely work with existing HomeKit-compatible smart locks.” - Mark Gurman

The upcoming smart doorbell reflects Apple's ongoing commitment to expanding its home automation and security product line, promising enhanced user experience through advanced technology.

Samsung Scaling Down Production of Galaxy Z Flip 7 and Galaxy Z Fold 7: Report - Gadgets 360
summary:
Samsung Scales Down Production of Galaxy Z Flip 7 and Galaxy Z Fold 7

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Gadgets 360

Samsung has reportedly reduced its production plans for the upcoming Galaxy Z Flip 7 and Galaxy Z Fold 7 due to poor sales of the Galaxy Z Fold 6 and Galaxy Z Flip 6.

  • Production plans cut to a total of around 5 million units for both models.
  • Galaxy Z Flip 7 targets 3 million units, Galaxy Z Fold 7 at 2 million units.
  • Previous cumulative target for Galaxy Z Fold 6 and Galaxy Z Flip 6 was 8.2 million units.
  • Pre-orders for current models decreased from 1.02 million to 910,000 units in Korea.
  • Sales of the current foldables fell by 16.3% year-on-year.
“The weak sales performance of the Galaxy Z Fold 6 and Galaxy Z Flip 6 seem to be the reason behind Samsung's decision to scale down production.”

In contrast, Samsung plans to increase production for its Galaxy S25 series, targeting roughly 37 million units.
newTitle: Samsung Scales Down Production of Galaxy Z Flip 7 and Galaxy Z Fold 7
